graphicInterface

Class GGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • graphicInterface.GGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GGame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Graphical interface of the game. If you want to use this interface, you have to call the constructor with an occurrence of your class which implements InterfaceGame. This graphical interface sends a message to your class in the receivedMessage method. This message contains one element of type: DATA_NAME, PLAY, PLAYRIGHT, JUMP, DRAW, VALIDPCPLAY or NEWGAME. - If the user clicks on the right mouse button the graphical interface tries to put the domino on the right side of the table. - If the user clicks on left mouse button, the graphical interface tries to put the domino on the left side of the table if the "putDominoOnLeftTable" method is used. - If the "putDominoOnTable" method is used, the graphical interface chooses on which side the domino is put on the table.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • addDominoInHand

      • getPlayerName

        public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
        Return the name written by the player.

      • putDominoOnTable

        public void putDominoOnTable(InterfaceDomino d)
        Put a domino on the graphic table. If domino does not match with graphical table, this domino is put on left side. Be careful with this use. If you want more security please use methods putDominoOnLeftTable and putDominoOnRightTable. But in this case you have to manage exception.
        Parameters:
        d - Domino to put on the table.

      • putDominoOnLeftTable

        public void putDominoOnLeftTable(InterfaceDomino d)
                          throws BadMatchException
        Put a domino on the left of the graphical table. If you do not want to manage exception, use the method putDominoOnTable().
        Parameters:
        d - Domino to put on the table.
        Throws:
        BadMatchException - if Domino does not match with table left side.

      • putDominoOnRightTable

        public void putDominoOnRightTable(InterfaceDomino d)
                           throws BadMatchException
        Put a domino on the right of the graphical table. If you do not want to manage exceptions, use the method putDominoOnTable().
        Parameters:
        d - Domino to put on the table.
        Throws:
        BadMatchException - if Domino does not match with table right side.

      • removeDominoFromHand

        public void removeDominoFromHand(InterfaceDomino d)
        Remove a domino from the graphical hand of the player.
